    public class TakePhotoActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    The activity responsible for taking a photo of the QR object or location, and then uploading it to Firebase.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  TakePhotoActivity.OnUploadListener
      A listener interface used to retrieve the url string after the photo has been uploaded to the db

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void capturePhoto()
      Method that deals with capturing the photo, storing it intermediately on the device, and then uploading it to Firebase database (document containing photo name and url), and Firebase storage (the actual .jpeg).
      private java.util.concurrent.Executor getExecutor()
      Helper function for building the ImageCapture object.
      private java.lang.String getFileExtension​(android.net.Uri uri)
      Returns a string of the extension of a given image file.
      private static boolean hasPermissions​(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String... permissions)
      Checks whether a permission is granted; in this case permission to access and write to the phone's storage.
      protected void onCreate​(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Called when activity launches; starts by intializing the storage references for firebase, the preview view, capture button and camera provider.
      void onRequestPermissionsResult​(int requestCode, java.lang.String[] permissions, int[] grantResults)
      Handler for when the user accepts or rejects the initial prompt for storage access.
      private void startCameraX​(androidx.camera.lifecycle.ProcessCameraProvider cameraProvider)
      Configure CameraX for camera facing, the preview and the ImageCapture.
      private void uploadFile​(TakePhotoActivity.OnUploadListener listener)
      Function for uploading the image to Firebase database and storage.

      • hasPermissions

        private static boolean hasPermissions​(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.lang.String... permissions)
        Checks whether a permission is granted; in this case permission to access and write to the phone's storage.
        Parameters:
        context - Interface for global information about application environment.
        permissions - Vararg of permission strings.
        Returns:
        Whether the permission has been granted.

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult​(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Handler for when the user accepts or rejects the initial prompt for storage access.
        Specified by:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in interface androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The request code passed in.
        permissions - The requested permissions. Never null.
        grantResults - The grant results for the corresponding permissions which is either PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED or PackageManager.PERMISSION_DENIED. Never null.

      • capturePhoto

        private void capturePhoto()
        Method that deals with capturing the photo, storing it intermediately on the device, and then uploading it to Firebase database (document containing photo name and url), and Firebase storage (the actual .jpeg). TODO currently the images are not compressed, but that's a detail that can be added in the later stages; apparently firebase can do this automatically?

      • getExecutor

        private java.util.concurrent.Executor getExecutor()
        Helper function for building the ImageCapture object.
        Returns:
        an Executor object that executes submitted Runnable tasks.

        cameraProvider - a singleton which can be used to bind the lifecycle of cameras to any LifecycleOwner within an application's process

        private java.lang.String getFileExtension​(android.net.Uri uri)
        Returns a string of the extension of a given image file.
        Parameters:
        uri - the local address of the image
        Returns:
        the file extension, for example ".jpeg"
